description: This course will examine the use of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) in health promotion and disease prevention, as well as in acute and chronic health conditions, through evidence-based research and practice. Implications of CAM on culture, health disparities, society, economics, safety, legal, ethical, and health policy issues will be explored and discussed.
name: CASE STUDY: USE OF COMPLEMENTARY AND ALTERNATIVE MEDICINE (CAM)

section.name: CASE STUDY: USE OF COMPLEMENTARY AND ALTERNATIVE MEDICINE (CAM)

values.name: CASE STUDY: USE OF COMPLEMENTARY AND ALTERNATIVE MEDICINE (CAM)
